Stock

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • Stock.Item

  • public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    The 'Item' class is used for storing information about the various items that populate the inventory management application.
    Author:
    Mary Millar

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Item(java.lang.String itemName, double itemCost, double itemPrice, int itemReorderPoint, int itemReorderAmount)
      A constructor that's used to declare an item that does not require temperature restricted storage.
      Item(java.lang.String itemName, double itemCost, double itemPrice, int itemReorderPoint, int itemReorderAmount, java.lang.Double itemTemp)
      A constructor that's used to declare an item that does require temperature restricted storage.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Item

        public Item(java.lang.String itemName,
            double itemCost,
            double itemPrice,
            int itemReorderPoint,
            int itemReorderAmount)
     throws StockException
        A constructor that's used to declare an item that does not require temperature restricted storage.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the item.
        itemCost - The manufacturing cost of the item.
        itemPrice - The sale price of the item.
        itemReorderPoint - The amount current stock of an item must fall under for more of the item to be reordered.
        itemReorderAmount - The amount that is reordered once an item falls under the reorder point.
        Throws:
        StockException - The exception thrown if: the item cost is less than zero, the item price is less than zero, the item reorder point is less than zero, or the item reorder amount is less than zero.

      • Item

        public Item(java.lang.String itemName,
            double itemCost,
            double itemPrice,
            int itemReorderPoint,
            int itemReorderAmount,
            java.lang.Double itemTemp)
     throws StockException
        A constructor that's used to declare an item that does require temperature restricted storage.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the item.
        itemCost - The manufacturing cost of the item.
        itemPrice - The sale price of the item.
        itemReorderPoint - The amount current stock of an item must fall under for more of the item to be reordered.
        itemReorderAmount - The amount that is reordered once an item falls under the reorder point.
        itemTemp - The temperature required for the item throughout the supply chain proccess.
        Throws:
        StockException - The exception thrown if: the item cost is less than zero, the item price is less than zero, the item reorder point is less than zero, the item reorder amount is less than zero, or the temperature is less than -20 or more than 10 degrees Celsius.

      • tempRequired

        public boolean tempRequired()
        This method is used to determine if the item needs to be temperature-controlled.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing if the item needs to be temperature-controlled (true) or not (false).

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Item item)
        This method compares each parameter of the current item against the input to determine if they equal.
        Parameters:
        item - The item that needs to be compared.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing if both items are identical (true) or not (false);
